doc.after: About 118Â tonnes of germanium was produced in 2011 worldwide, mostly in China (80 t), Russia (5 t) and United States (3 t).[24] Germanium is recovered as a by-product from sphalerite zinc ores where it is concentrated in amounts of up to 0.3%,[54] especially from sediment-hosted, massive ZnâPbâCu(âBa) deposits and carbonate-hosted ZnâPb deposits. Figures for worldwide Ge reserves are not available, but in the US it is estimated at 450Â tonnes.[24] In 2007 35% of the demand was met by recycled germanium.[50]
